entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 3:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED SURF THROUGH SATURDAY... A low in the Bering will move south towards Bristol Bay today resulting in northerly winds from the Bering Strait south across St Lawrence Island in the 20 to 30 mph range with gusts up to 40 mph. This will produce elevated surf along the northern side of St Lawrence Island with wave action 1 to 2 feet above the normal
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lonoke, southeastern Faulkner and northeastern Pulaski Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 530 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Olmstead, or 10 miles northwest of Little Rock AFB, moving east at 15 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 3:47PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Riverside County through 430 PM PDT... At 347 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Desert Center. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 3:34PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Riverside County through 415 PM PDT...
